com.mta.tehreer.text

Class TextTypesetter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mta.tehreer.text.TextTypesetter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Disposable

    public class TextTypesetter
extends java.lang.Object
implements Disposable
    Represents a typesetter which performs text layout. It can be used to create lines, perform line breaking, and do other contextual analysis based on the characters in the string.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TextTypesetter(android.text.Spanned spanned)
      Constructs the typesetter object using a spanned text.
      TextTypesetter(java.lang.String text, Typeface typeface, float fontSize)
      Constructs the typesetter object using given text, typeface and font size.

        public TextTypesetter(java.lang.String text,
                      Typeface typeface,
                      float fontSize)
        Constructs the typesetter object using given text, typeface and font size.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to typeset.
        typeface - The typeface to use.
        fontSize - The font size to apply.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if text is null or empty, or typeface is null

        Constructs the typesetter object using a spanned text.
        Parameters:
        spanned - The spanned text to typeset.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if spanned is null or empty

    • Method Detail

      • finalizable

        public static TextTypesetter finalizable(TextTypesetter textTypesetter)
        Wraps a typesetter object into a finalizable instance which is guaranteed to be disposed automatically by the GC when no longer in use. After calling this method, dispose() should not be called on either original object or returned object. Calling dispose() on returned object will throw an UnsupportedOperationException.

        Note: The behaviour is undefined if an already disposed object is passed-in as a parameter.

        Parameters:
        textTypesetter - The typesetter object to wrap into a finalizable instance.
        Returns:
        The finalizable instance of the passed-in typesetter object.

      • isFinalizable

        public static boolean isFinalizable(TextTypesetter textTypesetter)
        Checks whether a typesetter object is finalizable or not.
        Parameters:
        textTypesetter - The typesetter object to check.
        Returns:
        true if the passed-in typesetter object is finalizable, false otherwise.

      • suggestCharBoundary

        public int suggestCharBoundary(int charStart,
                               float maxWidth)
        Suggests a typographic character line break index based on the width provided. This can be used by the caller to implement a different line breaking scheme, such as hyphenation.
        Parameters:
        charStart - The starting index for the typographic character break calculations.
        maxWidth - The requested typographic character break width.
        Returns:
        The index (exclusive) that would cause the character break.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the following is true:
        • charStart is negative
        • charStart is greater than or equal to the length of source text
        • maxWidth is less than or equal to zero

      • suggestLineBoundary

        public int suggestLineBoundary(int charStart,
                               float maxWidth)
        Suggests a contextual line break index based on the width provided.
        Parameters:
        charStart - The starting index for the line break calculations.
        maxWidth - The requested line break width.
        Returns:
        The index (exclusive) that would cause the line break.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the following is true:
        • charStart is negative
        • charStart is greater than or equal to the length of source text
        • maxWidth is less than or equal to zero

      • createLine

        public TextLine createLine(int charStart,
                           int charEnd)
        Creates a line of specified string range.
        Parameters:
        charStart - The index to first character of the line in source text.
        charEnd - The index after the last character of the line in source text.
        Returns:
        The new line object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if charStart is negative, or charEnd is greater than the length of source text, or charStart is greater than or equal to charEnd

      • createTruncatedLine

        public TextLine createTruncatedLine(int charStart,
                                    int charEnd,
                                    float maxWidth,
                                    TextTruncation truncationType,
                                    TextLine truncationToken)
        Creates a line of specified string range, truncating it if it overflows the max width.
        Parameters:
        charStart - The index to first character of the line in source text.
        charEnd - The index after the last character of the line in source text.
        maxWidth - The width at which truncation will begin. The line will be truncated if its width is greater than the width passed in this.
        truncationType - The type of truncation to perform if needed.
        truncationToken - This token will be added to the point where truncation took place to indicate that the line was truncated. Usually, the truncation token is the ellipsis character (U+2026). The line specified in truncationToken should have a width less than the width specified by the maxWidth parameter.
        Returns:
        The new line which is truncated if it overflows the maxWidth.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if truncationType is null, or truncationToken is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the following is true:
        • charStart is negative
        • charEnd is greater than the length of source text
        • charStart is greater than of equal to charEnd
        • maxWidth is less than the width of line specified in truncationToken

      • createFrame

        public TextFrame createFrame(int charStart,
                             int charEnd,
                             android.graphics.RectF frameRect,
                             TextAlignment textAlignment)
        Creates a frame full of lines in the rectangle provided by the frameRect parameter. The typesetter will continue to fill the frame until it either runs out of text or it finds that text no longer fits.
        Parameters:
        charStart - The index to first character of the frame in source text.
        charEnd - The index after the last character of the frame in source text.
        frameRect - The rectangle specifying the frame to fill.
        textAlignment - The horizontal text alignment of the lines in frame.
        Returns:
        The new frame object.

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Description copied from interface: Disposable
        Releases the native memory of this object. Failing to call this method will cause memory leaks.

        Note: The behaviour of this method is undefined if called more than once on the same object.

        Specified by:
        dispose in interface Disposable
